messages: 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (01:40): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, can't you be on the panel?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:40): i'll be editing html5.
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (01:41): hmm, what if I edit it an hour for you (preferably a different hour, so I can watch the show :) )
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:41): i don't see the point in participating. what difference does it make if the webarch document changes, even if we do convince people to change it?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (01:42): i was mostly concerned with the entertainment value
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:42): if you want entertainment... the meeting is in a casino.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:42): and a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 and BenMillard will have a PS2
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (01:46): i think i'd have more of a laugh during that panel, but we'll see :)
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (01:49): (re wildcard domains)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:50): is trying to write some quick tests, but forgot how buggy browsers are
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:51): (My current problem is that I can add a certain key into Firefox's globalStorage, which is impossible to remove again)

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:52): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: Is there a thing where you can type in subdomain names and IPs, so you could put something like "*.philip" in the subdomain thing and point it at my server?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (01:52): I can make a custom DNS record
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (01:52): I'm not sure if it does wildcards
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (01:52): but give me an IP and I'll try
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (01:54): "We have now added the A record for *.philip.html5.org with value 92.243.11.39. Our DNS servers will start serving this record within a couple of minutes."
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:55): if that works i'll be impressed
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:55): $ hostx foo.philip.html5.org ns1.dreamhost.com
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:55): foo.philip.html5.org    A       92.243.11.39
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:56): Looks like that does work - thanks!
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:56): wow
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:56): i am shocked
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:56): that's awesome
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:56): time to set up wildcard domains everywhere!
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:56): wonders what to do now that he has control of an infinite number of origins
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:56): not infinite
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:56): just very very large
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:57): (dns names are length-limited and character-set limited)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:57): Close enough to infinite for all practical purposes :-)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:57): and for many impractical purposes too
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (01:57): btw, DreamHost still claims www.philip and ftp.philip, fwiw
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:58): turned off ftp
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (01:58): ok, both btw and fwiw is a bit too much
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:58): and you can turn off www, iirc
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:58): dunno if that affects dns though
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (01:58): I thought you could only make it redirect
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (01:58): (which I do for all sites)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:00): hm maybe
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:00): i thought you could disable it
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:00): i forget
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:12): Is there a way to clear globalStorage in Firefox?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:12): (via the UI)
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:13): btw, I can probably make *.philip.html5.org point back to the same server as philip.html5.org if you want
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:13): why are you testing something that's removed from the specification?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:13): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: that won't work
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:13): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: because philip.html5.org, if it's dreamhost, is a virtual server
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:14): hmm yeah, I suppose it would be a bit unclear where the requests go
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:14): It's apparently possible to set ServerAlias *.example.com in Apache, but I don't know if Dreamhost supports that
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:15): you might be able to ask them for it
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:15): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, though actually, it seems all my domains have a unique value for the A record, so maybe it's possible
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:15): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: it's not a dns problem, it's an apache problem

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:16): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: Because it's kind of close to localStorage, which makes it easier to attempt to write tests for localStorage and to discover likely bugs
1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b (02:19): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: at the bottom of Options->Advanced->Network, perhaps?
1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b (02:20): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: there's also "Offline Website data" in Tools->Clear Private Data
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:20): 1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b: That Network -> Offline Storage thing seems different, since the list is empty and 'clear now' doesn't clear globalStorage
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:21): 1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b: Clear Private Data doesn't seem to clear it, either
1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b (02:21): uh, that sounds like a bug
1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b (02:21): I'm not really familiar with the various *storages
1adba86c435b5fe0f7ea043370b1636b (02:21): file a bug, cc dcamp?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:26): does anyone have a bot hitting html5.org a lot?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:27): not to my knowledge
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:27): Oh, looks like clearing cookies works, as long as you restart the browser
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:27): which pages?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:27): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: Google might have one
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:27): keeps getting a x\uFFFDy key which he seems unable to delete

6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:27): it's not really a problem, but there is this thing that hits its 170000 times a month and probably more and identifies itself as "Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 5.5; Windows NT 5.0)"
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:28): and one that does it 20000+ and says "Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 5.5; Windows NT 5.0) Fetch API Request"
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:28): From the same IP?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:28): neither of those are google
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:28): unless we have a rogue server
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:28): (which is possible)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:28): which IPs?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:28): Google respects robots.txt no?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:29): unless we have a bug
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:29): (which is possible)
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:29): it's hitting /tools/web-apps-tracker which is not allowed to be indexed
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:29): which IPs?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:29): maybe that's why i was feeling the pain from html5.org :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:29): 203.162.3.165 is in vietnam, of all places
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:30): 203.162.3.165 appears to be a spam harvester
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:31): 203.160.1.70 looks like it's related
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:32): maybe a simple solution for now would be to just ban IE 5.5 :)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:37): so does any browser support <form accept-charset> ?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:38): I thought they all did
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:39): making some UTF-8 page, declare windows-1252 in that attribute, and see what happens?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:39): s/making/make/
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:39): since I'm fairly sure I've had to use it to make forms always submit UTF-8
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:39): i can't get forms to submit as anything but utf-8
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:40): http://twitter.com/waka/statuses/953993561
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:41): has not tried charsets+forms, but thinks that what 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e says is weird
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:41): fixed
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:42): http://philip.html5.org/misc/form.html
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:43): First goes to http://philip.html5.org/misc/form.html?foo=t%E9st, second goes to http://philip.html5.org/misc/form.html?foo=t%C3%A9st
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:43): in Opera 9.5 and Firefox 3
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:43): confirmed
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:43): ...but not IE8
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:43): add <input type=hidden name=_charset_> to those forms?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:45): they all send back C3 A9 when i paste it into the live dom viewer
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:46): Opera is consistent, IE6 does iso always for ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c's example
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:46): What if you do accept-charset=iso-8859-1 explicitly?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:46): same
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:46): always utf-8
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:46): i wonder why
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:47): so for a UTF-8 page accept-charset is ignored?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:47): could be
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:47): it makes some sense
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:47): Hmm, IE8 is a bit buggy - now that I have three identical forms on that page, it puts inconsistent spacing between them :-/
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:47): ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c: can you make a copy of that page for utf-8?
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:48): and utf-16 pretty please?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:48): also if you could cook me dinner that'd be awesome
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:49): http://philip.html5.org/demos/charset/form/
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:50): the utf-16 page is utf-8
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:51): That's because I haven't finished writing it :-)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:51): Ahh, help!

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:51): and I can't work out how to get it back
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:52): the UTF-8 one works identical to the ISO encoded one in Opera/Firefox
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:52): that is, accept-charset is acknowledged
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (02:52): BenMillard: If you don't have it, get my phone number from http://stuff a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554.com/http-parsing.html

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:54): 6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00: (UTF-16 is there now)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:55): i don't understand what IE is doing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:55): IE8b2
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (02:55): it doesn't work at all half the time

6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:56): hmm, in Opera default will say _charset_ UTF-8
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (02:56): in Firefox it says UTF-16LE but seems to submit UTF-8
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (03:01): adds POST to those pages
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:01): oh i know what's confusing me
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:01): <meta charset> is ignored if you're document.write()ing
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:01): so all these docs are utf-8 when i put them in the dom viewer
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (03:18): hmm
